posts.name: Anshu Raj
posts.cooked:
image1920×1080 263 KB

This is my question. So, there’re 30 rows in each group, and, I am supposed to work on group 5 to 50(both inclusive), that is, from row index 120 to 1499. I converted the pdf to a csv file, opened it using pandas, got the row index from 120 to 1499(I did cross check this being correct), and, then, I stored those rows where marks in Physics is greater than 63, and, then, used the .sum() on the new table. On doing this, I am getting a value which is something 29806(something around this).

Here, I am attatching my code.

image1920×1080 226 KB

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
@22f3000757

Without knowing how you obtained the csv, its impossible for me to verify your code is correct.

Is the Csv clean? A common mistake is assuming that the conversion from pdf to csv is without any anomalies.

There is an error in the conditions you used. It does not match what was asked in the question.

Also what is in row 1499? (will help verify that you have the right rows, though it will not account for anomalies at the pg breaks which may affect your sums)
| 69 | 43 | 75 | 52 | 39 |

Kind regards

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Vinay, @23f2003080

Sorry for the delay in replying. I generally do not reply if I have not been able to confirm officially a solution to the issue. It would not help anyone if I replied without any meaningful resolution. One thing you can be assured of is, we read ALL discourse posts.

I can confirm that we (the TDS team) has looked at this particular question with your specific parameter and we will give you the mark for this question as the city in question has changed (i.e. it has grown since the database was last updated). You have found the correct answer. Thanks for alerting us to the problem.

Kind regards,
